page.title: 14Farming in Glenisla.
page.content: There are six farms in this area.The total acreage of these farms is 5790 acres, 3290 acres of which are shown on the map. 2225 acres of these are rough pasture land used for grazing sheep. The remaining 1065 acres are used to grow oats, barley, turnips, potatoes, hay and sileage crops. Most of these are used for animal feeding in winter. Only one farm uses 11 acres for cash purposes. 5015 black-faced sheep are grazed on the rough hill pasture. The yield of lambs in 1985 was 3720, 2985 of which will be sold at the market. The remainder will be kept for breeding purposes. 380 cows graze on the lower pastures. These are mainly Aberdeen Angus, Fresian, Hereford and Blue-Grey crosses. All the farms keep at least one bull for breeding.
